text:
Subject: Thank the TDSB for Adopting an Anti-Palestinian Racism strategy
Sender: Canadians for Justice and Peace in the Middle East <info@cjpme.org>
Body: <https://www.cjpmecontent.org/tdsb_apr_policy>

Dear Nora,

Great news! Yesterday evening, the Toronto District School Board (TDSB) voted to include anti-Palestinian racism <https://www.cjpme.org/pr_2024_06_20_tdsb> (APR) as part of its Combating Hate and Racism strategy! This means that the TDSB has committed to developing resources to inform students about APR, alongside other forms of discrimination including Islamophobia and antisemitism.

This is a major victory and is a result of important advocacy work by Toronto Palestinian families <https://torontopalestinianfamilies.ca/>, Toronto Jewish families <https://torontojewishfamilies.wordpress.com/>, and others. Acknowledging APR is critically important amid the skyrocketing incidents of violence and hate against Palestinians and their supporters. Unfortunately, pro-Israel organizations continue to oppose any mention of APR and are actively campaigning to have this decision reversed.

Don't allow political pressure from pro-Israel groups erase Palestinian voices! Please click here to send a message to TDSB Trustees, the Ontario Education Minister, and other public officials. <https://www.cjpme.org/tdsb_apr_policy> Please join us in thanking the TDSB for their principled decision to address APR as part of its broader fight against all forms of racism

<https://www.cjpmecontent.org/tdsb_apr_policy>

Please share this campaign:

- Click here <https://nmshr.io/s/twitter/ZBE8BTXEHQ==/b> to Tweet, or retweet <https://x.com/CJPME/status/1803871768836260032> our campaign tweet
- Click here <https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=870748418430704&set=a.482363290602554> like and share our Facebook campaign post
- Click here <https://www.instagram.com/p/C8cvLJ5Te2b/> to like our main Instagram post
- Forward <https://nmshr.io/s/email/ZBE8BTXEHQ==/b> this email to your friends

More Info

A report <https://pub-tdsb.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=17569> adopted yesterday by the TDSB in a 15-7 vote <https://www.youtube.com/live/SVb3KShPlaM?feature=shared&t=21207> includes anti-Palestinian racism (APR) as an area of focus ‚Äúin response to student and community voices,‚Äù and follows advocacy from Toronto Palestinian and Jewish families. This means that a working group will be formed to educate students on APR, alongside other forms of discrimination including Islamophobia and antisemitism.

A working description of anti-Palestinian racism was first developed by the Arab-Canadian Lawyers Association (ACLA) in its 2022 report titled ‚ÄúAnti-Palestinian Racism: Naming, Framing and Manifestations <https://static1.squarespace.com/static/61db30d12e169a5c45950345/t/627dcf83fa17ad41ff217964/1652412292220/Anti-Palestinian+Racism-+Naming%2C+Framing+and+Manifestations.pdf>.‚Äù The ACLA describes APR as ‚Äúa form of anti-Arab racism that silences, excludes, erases, stereotypes, defames or dehumanizes Palestinians or their narratives,‚Äù and identifies various forms of APR, including ‚Äúdenying the Nakba and justifying violence against Palestinians,‚Äù ‚Äúfailing to acknowledge Palestinians as an Indigenous people with a collective identity,‚Äù and ‚Äúdefaming Palestinians and their allies with slander such as being inherently antisemitic, a terrorist threat/sympathizer or opposed to democratic values.

The need to adopt APR as part of anti-racism strategies around Canada is corroborated by the rise of violence and discrimination against Canadian Palestinians and their allies. Some recent examples of hateful acts include

text:
Name,

My Squad brother Jamaal Bowman lost his Congressional primary yesterday after being outspent 7 to 1.

Jamaal visited my Palestinian sity in Palestine‚Äôs West Bank when I couldn‚Äôt, and he recognized her humanity without hesitation. Unlike many of our colleagues in Congress, Jamaal hasn‚Äôt bowed down to those who believe killing thousands of Palestinian children is acceptable.

Because Jamaal believed that Palestinians deserve to live, the American Israel Public Affairs Committee (AIPAC) spent nearly $20 million to unseat him.

This is the most expensive U.S. House of Representatives primary ever. Funded mainly by far-right billionaires, AIPAC saturated the airwaves with racist attack ads and encouraged Republicans to register as Democrats to vote against Jamaal.

We can‚Äôt let AIPAC undermine our democracy or scare lawmakers into continued unconditional support for Israel‚Äôs military. So we‚Äôve got to defend AIPAC‚Äôs next target: Rep. Cori Bush.

Like Jamaal Bowman, Cori Bush is a courageous leader for Palestinians‚Äô human rights. AIPAC has already spent $2 million supporting Cori‚Äôs anti-ceasefire opponent, and the group will spend many millions more over the next month before Cori‚Äôs August 6th primary election in Missouri.

Can you help Cori Bush overcome millions of dollars in attacks from pro-genocide billionaires? Please rush an urgent donation to our re-election campaigns today.

RUSH A DONATION

Back in October of last year, Cori heeded the call from the grassroots to introduce a Congressional resolution demanding a ceasefire and humanitarian aid to Gaza. Like Jamaal, Cori was one of the first members of Congress to correctly refer to these attacks on Palestinians as ethnic cleansing and genocide.

In 2014 Cori met Palestinian activists on the streets of Ferguson, Missouri while protesting for Black lives, and she saw the connections between Black and Palestinian struggles against state violence. Since then, she‚Äôs criticized the U.S. government‚Äôs complicity in Israel‚Äôs human rights abuses

text:
Hi Nora,

Does it feel like, no matter how many job applications you send, you‚Äôre not getting callbacks?

 

Join us and career coach, David Alto, in our upcoming webinar to get specific advice on what your resume needs to start getting more interviews, and how you can use LinkedIn to help land your next role.

 

In this webinar, we will discuss:

Resume formatting tips
How to write the most effective resume sections - what to include, how to say it, and best present your information
Advice for reviewing and editing your resume
Using LinkedIn for networking to help land your next role
An open Q&A on resume writing (ask any questions you have about your resume)

Jobscan is 10 years old this year!

 

To celebrate 10 years of Jobscan, we are giving away one month of Jobscan Premium for ten winners. 

 

Just grab your seat, and you'll be entered to win one of 10 Jobscan Premium accounts. The winners will be announced live on the webinar.

text:
Hello Nora,

We hope you're having a good day!

Given your interest in AI Development & Machine learning, we would like to show you a new job listing for a Research Intern - AI-driven System and Database Design at Microsoft.

Below, we have summarized the main reasons why we recommend you to submit your application as soon as possible:

- Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI-driven system and database design
- Chance to collaborate with world-class researchers in AI infrastructure
- Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks like PyTorch

This role requires candidates currently enrolled in a program related to Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Machine learning. Proficiency in machine learning concepts and models, analytical skills, and the ability to work independently are essential.

If you're interested, we encourage you to take the next step and apply for this position!

Thank you and good luck with your search!

The Joinrs Team

text: Hi Nora, I hope you‚Äôre well! I‚Äôm Krizia, and I‚Äôm a recruiter at Meta for our Production Engineering team. I came across your profile and thought you could be a good match for our 2025 Production Engineer Intern position. Production Engineers (PEs) at Meta are a hybrid between software and systems engineers and are core to every significant engineering effort that keeps Meta running smoothly and scaling efficiently. PEs work within Meta's product and infrastructure teams to make sure our products and services are reliable and scalable. Our Production Engineering (PE) team is looking for someone who is knowledgeable about Linux/Unix operating systems, enjoys debugging, problem solving and is also a solid coder. Does this opportunity interest you? If so, can you please complete the next steps and answer the following questions please reply in-line via this email
